org.jtrim.utils

Class ExceptionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jtrim.utils.ExceptionHelper

  • public final class ExceptionHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains static helper methods for throwing specific exceptions. These includes helper method for checking arguments of methods and throw an exception if they are inappropriate.

    Thread safety

    Unless otherwise noted, methods of this class are safe to use by multiple threads concurrently.

    Synchronization transparency

    Methods of this class are synchronization transparent.

    • Method Detail

      • rethrow

        public static void rethrow(java.lang.Throwable ex)
        Throws the specified exception if it is an instance of Error or RuntimeException, or throws a RuntimeException exception with the specified exception as its cause.

        Note that this method never returns normally and always throws an exception.

        Parameters:
        ex - the exception to be thrown by this method. If it cannot be thrown due to being a checked exception, it will be wrapped in a cause of a RuntimeException and the RuntimeException is thrown instead. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified exception is null

      • checkIntervalInRange

        public static void checkIntervalInRange(int intervalStart,
                        int intervalEnd,
                        int minIndex,
                        int maxIndex,
                        java.lang.String argName)
        Checks if all the values of the specified interval is within the allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the interval is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

        More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

        intervalStart < minIndex || intervalEnd > maxIndex + 1

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        Parameters:
        intervalStart - the inclusive lower bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
        intervalEnd - the exclusive upper bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
        minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
        maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible int value.
        argName - the name of the interval to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the interval is found out of range. This argument is allowed to be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified interval is outside of the allowed range

      • checkIntervalInRange

        public static void checkIntervalInRange(long intervalStart,
                        long intervalEnd,
                        long minIndex,
                        long maxIndex,
                        java.lang.String argName)
        Checks if all the values of the specified interval is within the allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the interval is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

        More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

        intervalStart < minIndex || intervalEnd > maxIndex + 1

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        Parameters:
        intervalStart - the inclusive lower bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
        intervalEnd - the exclusive upper bound of the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
        minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
        maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the allowed value for the interval. This argument can be any possible long value.
        argName - the name of the interval to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the interval is found out of range. This argument is allowed to be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified interval is outside of the allowed range

      • checkArgumentInRange

        public static void checkArgumentInRange(int value,
                        int minIndex,
                        int maxIndex,
                        java.lang.String argName)
        Checks if the specified argument is within its allowed range and throws an IllegalArgumentException if it is not. In case the argument is within the allowed range, this method returns immediately to the caller.

        More formally, this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException if and only if:

        value < minIndex || value > maxIndex

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        Parameters:
        value - the value to be checked if it is within the allowed range. This argument can be any possible int value.
        minIndex - the inclusive lower bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible int value.
        maxIndex - the inclusive upper bound for the specified value. This argument can be any possible int value.
        argName - the name of the value to be checked. This string will be included in the message of the thrown IllegalArgumentException if the value is found to be out of its allowed range. This argument can be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - thrown if the specified value is not within its allowed range

      • checkNotNullElements

        public static void checkNotNullElements(java.lang.Object[] elements,
                        java.lang.String argumentName)
        Checks if the elements of the specified array or the array itself is not null and throws a NullPointerException if any of them is found to be null.

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        Parameters:
        elements - the array to be checked not to contain null elements
        argumentName - the name of the array to be checked. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the array is null or contains null elements. This argument is allowed to be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified array is null or contains null elements

      • checkNotNullElements

        public static void checkNotNullElements(java.util.Collection<?> elements,
                        java.lang.String argumentName)
        Checks if the elements of the specified collection or the collection itself is not null and throws a NullPointerException if any of them is found to be null.

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        Parameters:
        elements - the collection to be checked not to contain null elements
        argumentName - the name of the collection to be checked. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the collection is null or contains null elements. This argument is allowed to be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified collection is null or contains null elements

      • checkNotNullArgument

        public static void checkNotNullArgument(java.lang.Object argument,
                        java.lang.String argumentName)
        Checks if the specified argument is null and throws a NullPointerException if it is null.

        This method was designed for simple parameter validation of methods.

        This method is effectively the same as Objects.requireNonNull(Object, String) but throws an exception which has more descriptive message if only the name of the argument is specified.

        Parameters:
        argument - the object to be checked if it is null or not
        argumentName - the name of the argument to be checked if it is null or not. This string will be included in the thrown NullPointerException if the argument is found to be null. This argument is allowed to be null.
